pageContext.description: double mouth-moulding fairly widely spaced; lower one in rib form with three prominent vertical ribs descending on either face; ramains of casting flash; small punch marks and hammer ripples in patina; very slight blade tip hollows; no distinct line for edge bevel; rounded 'D' loop section; v. narrow rectangular socket end.
pageContext.patina: milky-reed green patina; several areas esp. corners, crests and mouth flaking to v. pale green and ruddy brown; numerous scattered small pocks into patina;
pageContext.surface: edge blunt through corrosion,many traces of light brown soil adhering
pageContext.collection: COLEMAN, Mr. R. - Private,72 Leasway, Wickford, Essex.
pageContext.site: ESSEX,BILLERICAY,WICKFORD,72 LEASWAY,found in the garden of 72 Leasway, on a new estate. It fell out of a pile of upcast earth which had dried in the sun. The land was previously meadow.
pageContext.remarks: SH. March 78,Submitted 8.3.78 by F. Bradshaw, 2 Formosa House, Mile End Rd, London E1 (father-in-law of Mr. Coleman)
